H0.text: Deposition is the process occurring when water freezes between cracks in rocks.

H1.text: Weathering is the process that occurs when water freezes between cracks in rocks.

H2.text: Sedimentation is the process that takes place when water freezes between cracks in rocks.

H3.text: Crystallization is the process that occurs when water freezes between cracks in rocks.

A4.text: Frost weathering is the collective name for those forms of physical weathering that are caused by the formation of ice within rock outcrops.

A5.text: Frost wedging is the widening of cracks or joints in rocks resulting from the expansion of porewater when it freezes.
